data.title: Python Highlighting is oddly off
data.body:
I tried to install a Twilight like theme from Sublime Text, and some of the colors aren't porting over properly. Here's an example showing how the Class name, inherited Class, and keys in a dict literal aren't matching how the theme looks in Sublime Text 3. VS Code on left, ST3 on right. These wrong colors aren't even part of the palette in the theme, so I don't know where they're coming from.
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: 10.11

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Install Twilight theme https://gist.github.com/Redoubts/f37f3a267a3ee05b3b4599444806b81e
2. Observe odd coloration

data.title: Allow to add file reference with drag and drop.
data.body:
It is very common use case when user wants to add reference of module file (external file) by dragging and dropping it to editor. But right now VScode is not supporting this feature. When user try to drag a file from the explorer window it is opening that file in the editor.

In the below screen shout you can compare Visual studio and VS code action for drag and drop.

![draganddrop](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14516513/923053d4-01b8-11e6-9359-c5a29b54f980.gif)

data.body:

data.title: Reference completion produces bad code
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11 
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Start typing `/// <referen`
2.  When the completion suggestion pops up, press enter

Expected output is `/// <reference path="" />` but you end up with `/// </// <reference path="" />`.

![](http://i.imgur.com/P7HXh6V.gif)

data.title: Multiple cursors do not insert generated snippet at all cursors

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add a cursor above your current one
2. Add a code snippet (for, do, etc)

Actual:
Snippet will only be generated at the original cursor location.

![multiplecursorsnippet](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14512729/7fdae1da-0196-11e6-84b9-76a43c9190c1.gif)

data.title: Error message is chopping while working with multi screen.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open root dir for NodeJSExpress project.
2. Open multi screen (3 screen) and try to add reference to the typing files.
3. Verify error message and hover over to get complete error message details.

Actual: When user is working with multi screen then error massage is chopping.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14512656/db1da3b2-0195-11e6-851f-71c1c17583ed.png)

Expected: It should display complete message when hover over on highlighted error.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14512699/2ff37272-0196-11e6-8240-a6a3cade44d2.png)

data.title: Keyboard shortcut for add cursor above/below not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file
2. Put your cursor on a line and press Ctrl+Alt+UpArrow

Actual:
Nothing happens. No other cursors are made. If you press F1 and select it from the actions list it does work.

data.title: Keyboard shortcuts to open a definition to the side is not working on windows and MAC.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10 and MAC

I followed the steps mentioned in the release notes for **Workbench** as below:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14505104/9489cdfa-016c-11e6-82d8-3507f32e5171.png)

More reference : https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2660 

I am able to open side window from command palette by selecting option "Open Definition....".

But keyboard shortcuts are not working on windows and MAC: CTRL+K F12 and Command+K F12

data.title: Node debug processes hang
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. clone vscode-eslint
2. cd eslint && npm install && code-alpha .
3. cd eslint-server && npm install && code-alpha .
4. press Ctrl+Shift+B in both instances
5. Install eslint npm package into a workspace folder (npm install eslint)
6. Switch to the one having eslint open
7. Press F5. In the dev instance open the workspace folder created in step 5
8. Switch to code having eslint-server open
9. Attach the debugger to the server by pressing F5
10. Go to the dev instance and reload the instance
11. Go back to code having eslint-server open
12. Try to reattach the debugger. It fails
    
    I am pretty sure that this worked in the past.

data.title: Elementary OS Freya VSCode icon issues.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Elementary OS Freya

Hello!

When running VSCode under Elementary OS Freya the VSCode icon is blurry and not focused compared to other icons it seems. Also I am not able to pin in to the Dock and open VSCode from there. It only gives me the option to close VSCode when it's opened. Other programs give me the option to keep them in the Dock.

Blurriness in icon issue:
![VSCode icon](https://sc-cdn.scaleengine.net/i/3b74977c06e3782866e8ec270a558e46.png)

Dock issue:
I am not able to take a screenshot of this issue but it basically gives me only one option and that is to close VSCode.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run Elementary OS Freya.
2. Open VSCode.

data.title: Error while installing .NET Core Debugger (VSC 0.10.11)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64

Can't install the C# debugger.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install .NET Core SDK
2. 1.1. dotnet --version =  **_1.0.0-rc2-002349_**
3. Create a new dummy project (dotnet new)
4. Restore (dotnet restore)
5. Check build is working, and works (dotnet build)
6. Install VS Code (**_0.10.11_**)
7. Install C# extensions for VSC (open VSC, press F1, type: **_ext install c#,_** press Enter and wait the installer to finish)
8. Restart VSC after C# extensions have been installed
9. In VSC, open a CS file, and check the output window
10. After installing dependencies, you eventually get to the debugger installation, and get a: 

> Error: Can not find runtime target for framework 'DNXCore,Version=v5.0' compatible with one of the target runtimes: 'win81-x64, win8-x64, win7-x64'. Possible causes:
> 1. The project has not been restored or restore failed - run `dotnet restore`
> 2. The project does not list one of 'win81-x64, win8-x64, win7-x64' in the 'runtimes' section.

This is my project.json file:

`{
  "version": "1.0.0-*",
  "compilationOptions": {
    "emitEntryPoint": true
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "Microsoft.NETCore.App": {
      "type": "platform",
      "version": "1.0.0-rc2-3002349"
    }
  },
  "frameworks": {
    "netcoreapp1.0": {
      "imports": [
        "portable-net45+wp80+win8+win81-x64+win8-x64+wpa81+dnxcore50"
      ]
    }  
  }
}`

and NuGet.config file (root of the project):

`<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <packageSources>
    <clear />
    <add key="dotnet-core" value="https://dotnet.myget.org/F/dotnet-core/api/v3/index.json" />
    <add key="api.nuget.org" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" protocolVersion="3" />
    <add key="nuget.org" value="https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/" />
  </packageSources>
</configuration>`

And this is my NuGet.config file inside of "Users\%USER%\.vscode\extensions\ms-vscode.csharp-0.3.7\coreclr-debug":

`<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <packageSources>
    <!--To inherit the global NuGet package sources remove the <clear/> line below -->
    <clear />
    <add key="dotnet-core" value="https://www.myget.org/F/dotnet-core/api/v3/index.json" />
    <add key="api.nuget.org" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" />
    <add key="coreclr-debug" value="https://www.myget.org/F/coreclr-debug/api/v3/index.json" />
  </packageSources>
</configuration>`

Thanks.

data.title: Option for sorting files by type in Explorer
data.body: It would be nice to have a "Sort/Order by type" option which will sort the files by types (and then by name) in the file explorer.

data.title: [html] attribute values should not need to be quoted to be highlighted
data.body:
HTML attribute values only need quoting if they have spaces in them (the quotes are optional) - but the highlighter presumes that quotes are mandatory, and so does not highlight attribute values if you leave out the quotes.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a new HTML file
2. Type `<meta charset=UTF-8>`
3. Compare with `<meta charset="UTF-8">`

Only the value surrounded by quotes is highlighted properly:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/441934/14491793/d7f98890-0172-11e6-8069-45a47f2bcbb4.png)

data.title: Focus vanishes after refactoring
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Ubuntu 15.10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Press F2 on a variable
2. Refactor the name
3. Focus is somewhere else, but not in the editor anymore

data.title: simplify telemetry implementation
data.body: Today we have an interface that describes the contract of telemetry (ITelemetryService) which is OK. The bad thing is that there many implementations of that interface (AbstractTS, MainTS, ElectronTS, AbstractRemoteTS, WorkerTS, ExtHostTS, NullTS, MockTS, TestTS) which have led to leakage and duplication of events. I believe this problem should be solved with less code and abstraction

data.title: Allow to open same folder in multiple windows

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Visual Studio Code (called window 1)
2. Open D:\Project
3. CTRL-SHIFT-N or File -> New Window (called window 2)
4. In the new window, Open D:\Project again

expected:
New Window, the window 2, will also have the folder D:\Project just like window 1.

Result:
Instead of opening the D:\Project in window 2, it give focus to window 1 and leave window 2 sitll open nothing.

Reason:
1. I am working with multi monitors, at least 2, and 1 monitor will most likely only able to hold 2 tabs at max so that i can compare code within the same project. I will need another window to put the other tab even though it's under the same folder, maybe it's not a problem i i have the same monitor resolution, but currently, i am using one laptop monitor (1366x768) and additional lcd monitor (1920x1080) which give problem if i try to display the editor under resolution (3286x ????) just to compare codes.
1. There is no option to let the editor tab float as independent window

Could this be because of the engine(Chromium) that Visual Studio Code shares with Atom editor(Atom is havig the same issue)?!

data.title: React JSX code block syntax highlight not working.
data.body:
VSCode's support for React development is awesome except for JSX evaluated block's syntax highlight, code within curly braces can only show with only one color.

I have tried to tweak TypeScriptReact tmTheme and tmLanguage file, but I found tmTheme won't treat code inside curly braces as common JS expressions, and I cannot get consistent colors like code outside of markups. 

It would be nice to be able to distinguish tag name, attributes, keywords, quoted string,  constant by color, whether it's in or outside of JSX curly braces.

I think it shouldn't be too hard to fix this, how can it be done?
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.4

![screen shot 2016-04-13 at 3 03 48 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6767625/14485339/01b5ec94-0189-11e6-8ca5-31c2a66f424a.png)
